page.title: 03CLEWER VILLAGE
page.content:
In the village stands the oldest building in Windsor,{St.Andrews Church.The Font is Saxon and comes from the original saxon church.The church lodge is now Clewer history museum.It is a listed building of architectural and historic importance built in 1866 and designed by Henry Woodyer.The museum is packed with artefacts and documents from the domesday reference to the present day in Clewer village.
Much of the churchyard is purposely overgrown to support Nature Conservancy.They specialise in rare wild plants.In 1982 an Essay describing Clewer Church museum and the churchyard won joint 2nd prize in the international{Kenneth Allsop {MEMORIAL COMPETITION. {
